Sentencas: The combination of distributed energy systems (DES) and solar energy is considered a vital measure to save the usage of fossil energy.
Titulo: Thermodynamic and economic analysis of a multi-energy complementary distributed CCHP system coupled with solar thermochemistry and active energy storage regulation process

Sentencas: A new distributed combined cooling, heating and power (CCHP) system integrated with solar thermochemistry (STC) and energy storage (ES) units is proposed.
Titulo: Thermodynamic and economic analysis of a multi-energy complementary distributed CCHP system coupled with solar thermochemistry and active energy storage regulation process

Sentencas: The methane steam reforming (MSR) reaction is driven by solar energy to produce hydrogen-rich syngas, which is fed with high-efficiency solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) - micro gas turbine (MGT) to produce electricity.
Titulo: Thermodynamic and economic analysis of a multi-energy complementary distributed CCHP system coupled with solar thermochemistry and active energy storage regulation process

Sentencas: The residual heat of the flue gas drives a double effect lithium bromide unit for cooling and a heat exchanger for heating, while a parabolic trough collector (PTC) is used to supplement cooling and heating supply.
Titulo: Thermodynamic and economic analysis of a multi-energy complementary distributed CCHP system coupled with solar thermochemistry and active energy storage regulation process

Sentencas: Under different weather conditions and user load demands, simulation analysis of the matching between system outputs and user loads is conducted, and the thermodynamic and economic performance are analyzed.
Titulo: Thermodynamic and economic analysis of a multi-energy complementary distributed CCHP system coupled with solar thermochemistry and active energy storage regulation process

Sentencas: The results show that through active energy storage regulation, the new system outputs can meet the hourly user loads with a matching degree of 1.
Titulo: Thermodynamic and economic analysis of a multi-energy complementary distributed CCHP system coupled with solar thermochemistry and active energy storage regulation process

Sentencas: The total exergy efficiencies of the system on typical summer, transition and winter days are 69.93%, 62.03%, and 52.28%, respectively, and the specific CO2 emission rates are 152.57 g/kWh, 191.75 g/kWh, and 234.16 g/kWh, respectively, indicating that the system has higher exergy efficiency and is more environmentally friendly under strong solar radiation.
Titulo: Thermodynamic and economic analysis of a multi-energy complementary distributed CCHP system coupled with solar thermochemistry and active energy storage regulation process

Sentencas: Economic analysis indicates that the capital investment cost is 779.34 k$, and the revenue begins in the 9-th year.
Titulo: Thermodynamic and economic analysis of a multi-energy complementary distributed CCHP system coupled with solar thermochemistry and active energy storage regulation process
